bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 164, Number 99 (Thursday, June 14, 2018)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. ROUZER:H.R. 6119.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1, Section 8, Clause 3 of the U.S. Constitution.[Page H5201]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.

summary.text: This bill requires the Department of the Interior to issue a rule to remove the red wolf, Canis rufus, in North Carolina from the list of endangered and threatened wildlife.

bill.title: To remove the red wolf from the list of endangered and threatened wildlife for North Carolina, and for other purposes.

item.title: To remove the red wolf from the list of endangered and threatened wildlife for North Carolina, and for other purposes.
To remove the red wolf from the list of endangered and threatened wildlife for North Carolina, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
